flawed_nl_solution:
From the 200 cookies, Javier's wife ate 3/10*200 = <<3/10*200=2000/3>>2000/3
After the wife ate 2000/3 cookies, the number of cookies that remained was 200-2000/3 = <<200-2000/3=-1400/3>>-1400/3
The daughter also ate 40 cookies leaving -1400/3-40 = <<-1400/3-40=-1520/3>>-1520/3 cookies.
If Javier ate half of the remaining cookies, he ate 1/2*-1520/3 = -760/3.
The number of cookies that remained is -1520/3--760/3 = <<-1520/3--760/3=-760/3>>-760/3

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 60, not 2000/3. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
